messages.subject: Re: Which Chiba is which? + Chrysanthemum dolls
messages.msgSnippet: ... Tama-san explained that better than I :) ... Yes, that s right. And sometimes, Iba dojo of Shingyoto Ryu is also included in the list, making the four
messages.messageBody:
> This is where I get confused. You say that Sadakichi
> was Shusaku's
> brother? But I saw one website that listed him as
> his nephew. To make
> matters even more confusing, Hillsborough states
> that Sadakichi was
> the master of one of the "three greatest fencing
> schools in Edo" and
> Ryoma was the "head" of this school.


Tama-san explained that better than I :)



> The problem is that if you look up these two,
> Shusaku's Genbukan Dojo
> is listed as one of the "three greatest" in Edo.
> [The other two were
> Shunzo Momonoi's Shigakukan Dojo (Kyoshin Meichi
> Ryu) and Saito
> Yakuro's Renpeikan Dojo (Shindo Munen Ryu).]



Yes, that's right. And sometimes, Iba dojo of
Shingyoto Ryu is also included in the list, making the
"four greatest" in Edo.

By the way, it's "Shinto Munen", not "Shindo Munen" :)
Dang Japanese names :D



> This
> might fit since
> Hillsborough calls the other two dojo by the names
> of the
> swordmasters rather than their official name. (He
> calls
> them "Momonoi" and "Saito" schools.) But then Ryoma,
> to be "head"
> of "Chiba Dojo" would have had to study under
> Shusaku rather than
> Sadakichi?!



No. "Chiba dojo" could either mean Chiba Shusaku's and
Chiba Sadakichi's. Ryoma was the "jukutou", the "head
student", who represented the dojo, but the real
"owner" of the dojo, so to speak, was Chiba Sadakichi.


> Another curious thing, I note that on Serizawa's
> site it is stated
> that Yamanami studied at the Genbukan? So it becomes
> more likely then
> that Ryoma and Yamanami would have known each
> other?! Even if it -was-
> another school, they would have met each others
> students I would
> assume?


As Tama-san did put it, it is possible that they had
met, but not certain, unfortunately. The same goes
with Toudou Heisuke. Likewise, it is possible, but not
likely, that Nagakura met Serizawa before the
Shinsengumi and all.

As for the chrysanthemum dolls that appeared in a
previous post, they are NOT from Bange, AFAIK. Bange
is a place next to Aizu Wakamatsu, but not famous by
its dolls. The "kikuningyo" is from Nihonmatsu and its
neighborhood.

http://p133.pcsn.co.jp/~nihonmatsu/kiku.html



=====
Serizawa Kamo

Steel is my body,and fire is my blood.
I have created over a thousand blades.
Unknown to Death.
Nor known to Life.
Have withstood pain to create many weapons.
Yet, those hands will never hold anyting.
So as I pray, unlimited blade works."
